All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AbstractDAO<T>
This is an AbstractDAO class that provides the basic CRUD operations for a given type.
Bill
This is a Bill record class that represents a bill in the system.
BillBLL
This is a BillBLL class that handles the business logic for bills.
BillDAO
This is a BillDAO class that handles the database operations for bills.
BillValidator
This is a BillValidator class that validates the total amount and creation date of a bill.
Client
This is a Client class that represents a client in the system.
ClientBLL
This is a ClientBLL class that handles the business logic for clients.
ClientDAO
This is a ClientDAO class that handles the database operations for clients.
ClientValidator
This is a ClientValidator class that validates the details of a client.
ConnectionFactory
This is a ConnectionFactory class that handles the database connection.
Controller
This is a Controller class that handles the interaction between the View and the Business Logic Layer (BLL).
Main
The Main class is the entry point of the application.
Order
This is an Order class that represents an order in the system.
OrderBLL
This is an OrderBLL class that handles the business logic for orders.
OrderDAO
This is an OrderDAO class that handles the database operations for orders.
OrderValidator
This is an OrderValidator class that validates the details of an order.
Product
This is a Product class that represents a product in the system.
ProductBLL
This is a ProductBLL class that handles the business logic for products.
ProductDAO
This is a ProductDAO class that handles the database operations for products.
ProductValidator
This is a ProductValidator class that validates the details of a product.
Validator<T>
This is a Validator interface that defines a method for validating objects of a generic type.
View
This is a View class that represents the user interface of the application.
